title: AFNR - Food Products and Processing Systems
subject: Agriculture, Food and Natural Resources (AFNR) (2015-)

document.title: Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Standards

9EDCC053F6964B7EA5534749081B58DB.description:
Construct and implement
plans that ensure adherence to industry
standards for food products and processing
facilities.

4DE00E40E60944F48E87E37DBEA66953.description:
Assess and summarize the
application of industry standards in the food
products and processing industry.

1F0A285B749F4B169A7514E8474C47EF.description:
Examine and describe the
importance and usage of regulatory oversight
of food safety and security in food products
and processing (e.g., internationally, nationally,
state and local).

8D08E226CB2F46EDA727428CDA862D07.description:
Construct and implement
methods to obtain data about organizations,
groups and regulatory agencies that affect
the food products and processing industry.

3DFD4EAFAD224EECBF29909F4A4F1D4E.description:
Evaluate the changes in
the food products and processing industry
brought about by industry organizations or
regulatory agencies.

06D283419C804563866404898F478ADB.description:
Examine and summarize the
purposes of organizations that influence or
regulate the food products and processing
industry.

5BE3BC88F30A46CA8C54A748F113A1CA.description:
Identify and explain the purpose of industry organizations, groups and regulatory
agencies that influence the local and global food systems.

6A144A24396B4AFD8148B112B2B232DA.description:
Examine and respond to
consumer concerns about the environment
and safety of the food supply using accurate
information regarding food products and
processing systems and practices.

6E59603B11774A08949F61CD1F673A51.description:
Research and summarize
current issues related to the safety and environmental
concerns about foods and food
processing (e.g., GMOs, irradiation, microorganisms,
contamination, etc.).

A2750B87751E43E7B7371CE517475C03.description:
Identify and explain environmental
and safety concerns about the food
supply

0ED81A49D37249CA8CE88CD63B9A04F2.description:
Predict and defend upcoming
changes and trends in the food products and
processing industry.

ED001C254A6E41408AC64058820FE7CE.description:
Analyze and document
significant changes and trends in the food
products and processing industry.

9E5F6D156D71432A813F3DC75380F244.description:
Describe and explain the
components of the food products and processing
industry (e.g., processing, distribution,
byproducts, etc.).

97C02CB68454476DA1E6F3CAAFB7A64E.description:
Evaluate the significance and implications of changes and trends in the food
products and processing industry in the local and global food systems.

CAC02035ABC549DF9C8B0A19A3F560ED.description:
Propose and implement culturally
sensitive food processing and distribution
practices.

7D657D49AF3E4298ABC418633E9E0715.description:
Analyze food production
and distribution outcomes based on cultural
customs.

3DD254673C1446F3B1AD52692652E841.description:
Compare and contrast cultural
differences regarding food products and
processing practices.

71A0573087AC4212A73246C6BAE47C7C.description:
Devise and implement a
strategy to create food products that meet a
specific consumer trend in a specific market.

73E62480557640B088EE2058E74223B4.description:
Construct and implement
methods to obtain data on food consumer
trends in a specific market.

3C9BD3B7366F405CA2929694FE85C743.description:
Examine the impact of consumer
trends on food products and processing
practices (e.g., health and nutrition, organic,
information about food products, local
food movements, farm-to-fork supply chains,
food system transparency, etc.).

BB4BBAE130C94C2EBEBBF77F8A173AA5.description:
Articulate and defend a personal
point of view on policies and legislation
that affect the food products and processing
system in the U.S. or around the world.

DB7E4546C2D441A3999172A78328F4D0.description:
Analyze the similarities and
differences amongst policies and legislation
that affect the food products and processing
system in the U.S. or around the world.

79CCCE01A5BA4A06AC29CB76DFE5D000.description:
Research and summarize
examples of policy and legislation that affect
food products and processing systems in the
United States and around the world (e.g., labeling,
GMOs, biosecurity, food system policy,
dietary guidelines, etc.).

4882BB9344F347DFA247BE827A2293EF.description:
Examine the scope of the food industry by evaluating local and global policies,
trends and customs for food production.

8163AACDE65D427ABB3A72AA56AC5CB0.description:
Explain the scope of the food industry and the historical and current
developments of food product and processing.

FA757C549FE84EEEA4E99EA64B4D7350.description:
Propose distribution plans
for food products that meet specific market
demands.

1AD3CD619BEB452EAA1CBDF563ED4E55.description:
Assess and explain how market
demand for food products influences the
distribution of food products.

ED497594D59B48548B24F55C52AE238C.description:
Research and summarize
different types of market demands for food
products (e.g., local food, organic, non-GMO,
etc.).

9FA5D92D0DA34EA19DECC3C3130BB3D7.description:
Make recommendations to
improve safety procedures used in food distribution
scenarios to ensure a safe product is
being delivered to consumers.

4AA3153695C6454AAF22E4026D9E8F98.description:
Interpret safety procedures
used in food distribution to ensure a safe
product is being delivered to consumers.

2E47B363A1A547D2A406535595DF87E3.description:
Examine the various paths
food products take to get from food processing
centers to consumers.

8AFDB8BE1343421A9530338EEE2342EE.description:
Devise and defend a strategy
to determine ways for food distribution to
reduce environmental impacts.

F3A44D07CBFF4D52A019916F367215E8.description:
Research and document
ways to reduce environmental impact from
food distribution activities.

427DF202969A494386C0A58179456607.description:
Assess and describe the environmental
impact of distributing food locally
and globally.

F587B61FAB12481B991C80501C261A46.description:
Create food distribution plans and procedures to ensure safe delivery of food
products.

3499B8E4B493461498698E35F93CC1CF.description:
Construct and implement
methods of selecting packaging materials to
store a variety of food products.

64EC777AE73544CB9CFBDB7E8DBC0103.description:
Analyze the degree of desirable
food qualities of foods stored in various
packaging.

D002648FAC1B467E9D06277740411CF7.description:
Summarize types of materials
and methods used in food packaging and
presentation.

56EC780718F84986892636D75711ADC4.description:
Devise and apply strategies
to preserve different foods using various
methods and techniques.

FDD46CA3483946BC831243B277415272.description:
Analyze and document food
preservation processes and methods on a
variety of food products.

99F6F05621EC43508F9E54F94B527A21.description:
Identify methods of food
preservation and give examples of foods preserved
by each method.

C3BD6CE84ADD4658983DC5A06104C505.description:
Evaluate food quality factors
on foods prepared for different markets (e.g.,
shelf life, shrinkage, appearance, weight, etc.).

2C538CC766744FA9AEB5471F30A8E014.description:
Outline appropriate methods
and prepare foods for sale and distribution
for different markets.

450A56CFE90F466395B41F8475FFA157.description:
Differentiate between methods
and materials used for processing food
for different markets (e.g., fresh food products,
ready to eat food products, etc.).

83824DF728974320B404147FF9810EDE.description:
Design plans to formulate
and package food products using a variety of
weights and measures.

D78A000199B34848AC5BA7CDF6866867.description:
Compare weights and measurements
of products and perform conversions
between units of measure.

810EBCC72DD341F59F52B0C50732401E.description:
Identify and explain English
and metric measurements used in the food
products and processing industry.

DB40BB537FD648C0986DEB4B3758A0C6.description:
Design and apply techniques of food processing, preservation, packaging and
presentation for distribution and consumption of food products.

90CCFE7A6E784CAD87CD8A1C71B37693.description:
Evaluate and grade food
products from different classifications of food
products.

BA3723D73B8441C88498074E77082472.description:
Examine and summarize
desirable qualities of food products derived
from different classifications of food products.

934C9D5086FF4C169B3C02B0B20732F7.description:
Identify and describe foods
derived from different classifications of food
products (e.g., meat, egg, poultry, fish, dairy,
fruits, vegetables, grains, legumes, oilseeds,
etc.).

78A1022275EA40A8A3C0EDAF5A066896.description:
Examine and respond to
consumer concerns about the inspection and
harvesting techniques of animals using accurate
information based on regulatory agency
approved or industry-approved techniques.

A9C5787A7641433C8B9302E0669C09E4.description:
Examine and evaluate inspection
and harvesting of animals using regulatory
agency approved or industry-approved
techniques.

4D4EA524FCCF43F9A26F9211DBE164AA.description:
Identify and describe protocols
for inspection and harvesting techniques
for animal food products (e.g., pre-mortem
and post-mortem inspections, Food Safety
Inspection Service guidelines (FSIS), etc.).

3CA8995D3FEB4778893AE75A94E9FB57.description:
Develop, apply and evaluate
care and handling procedures to maintain
original food quality and yield.

E35CF9DF420C4000999788F06EBD9008.description:
Assemble procedures to perform
quality-control inspections of raw food
products for processing.

EF16053E325244A683FB18AB472FB83C.description:
Summarize procedures to select
raw food products based on yield grades
and quality grades.

EB773F867BFF401782682210FE49A92E.description:
Outline procedures to assign
quality and yield grades to food products
according to industry standards.

86690FAE20B347499AB53E5DC474D496.description:
Analyze factors that affect
quality and yield grades of food products.

5B9F9EFA9EA44844A168EF285597A0BC.description:
Summarize characteristics of
quality and yield grades of food products.

2D36A7C8E98E4D38826EA1FE1791DA83.description:
Implement selection, evaluation and inspection techniques to ensure safe and
quality food products.

CC62083CB51140F1A363A2741AE38C69.description:
Select and process food products for storage, distribution and
consumption.

6950DA2D5D6345ADAB3CD98ADCA8E4AD.description:
Design new food products
that meet a variety of goals (e.g., consumer
preferences, market, nutritional needs, regulatory
requirements, etc.).

6A404297467A4DD993749D7B1C877FDB.description:
Determine consumer preference
and market potential for a new food
product using a variety of methods (e.g.,
double-blind testing, etc.).

D9C468798A2E4AA99C8181CADE22F168.description:
Research and summarize
relevant factors in planning and developing a
new food product (e.g., regulation, creativity,
economics, etc.).

797C4DF671AA40C78C8C2ABB6DC0020F.description:
Determine a strategy to prepare
and label foods according to the established
standards of regulatory agencies.

44D8FD62801546229F7C611861F2C960.description:
Examine, interpret and explain
the meaning of required components on
a food label.

3EAA40402B2D402A8C2822A1E0905FC8.description:
Examine and explain the importance
of food labeling to the consumer.

B48D8C9793694B23A7C99CBE3595C477.description:
Apply principles of human behavior to develop food products to provide a safe,
wholesome and nutritious food supply for local and global food systems.

194CED63623F48479A7236445AFDE359.description:
Develop and implement
plans to engineer new food items using biochemistry
concepts.

B7E92CDDC5E2463C923D88CB303795D4.description:
Analyze how food products
and processing facilities use biochemistry
concepts to develop new food products.

304DCB3761F84D439A22CCB631D9FE05.description:
Research and summarize the
application of biochemistry in the development
of new food products (e.g., value added
food products, genetically engineered food
products, etc.).

902B50DFB288418EB8D16C62359A671D.description:
Devise and apply strategies
to determine what additives are utilized and
why they are included in a variety of food
products.

280B41337CE24940A7BCBF2626D31640.description:
Describe the purpose of
common food additives and how they influence
the chemistry of food.

E39D17D77E8144A98DFC920345936997.description:
Identify common food
additives and identify their properties (e.g.,
preservatives, antioxidants, buffers, stabilizers,
colors, flavors, etc.).

1EA1C35B76D347B2BD27034BB0106B3F.description:
Design and conduct experiments
to determine the chemical a

1460B3E0C1AA4D5AB4F053BCD6C77264.description:
Explain how the chemical
and physical properties of foods influence
nutritional value and eating quality.

5214EFB04C0048648AF194FA505AECD3.description:
Examine and describe the
basic chemical makeup of different types of
food.

0408043BE5DA4A90958583B8F344B4A8.description:
Apply principles of microbiology and chemistry to develop food products to
provide a safe, wholesome and nutritious food supply for local and global food systems.

C3BAD66BD485447AA0DD2065F2E1F294.description:
Construct methods to design
a healthy daily food guide for a variety of
nutritional needs.

F79443162233498C8922D1371538CE1A.description:
Compare and contrast the
nutritional needs of different human diets.

8741598376EF40CDA66CB11FE68A962A.description:
Research and report methods
of nutritional planning to meet essential
needs for the human diet (e.g., MyPlate).

95C44EB546F24717815CE34F72DBD745.description:
Analyze the properties of
food products to identify food constituents
and evaluate nutritional value.

48002A273AB94592A5DBA86C5D93FB04.description:
Compare and contrast the
relative value of food constituents relative to
food product qualities (e.g., taste, appearance,
etc.).

B8B8F442660447A8AC864780B45B78BE.description:
Research and summarize
properties of common food constituents
(e.g., proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins,
minerals).

4CC0C8C7A55A4EB1A8F958ABC95CA7B6.description:
Apply principles of nutrition and biology to develop food products that provide a
safe, wholesome and nutritious food supply for local and global food systems.

99A34EF17FD944BDAC67B20FDAD7D08B.description:
Apply principles of nutrition, biology, microbiology, chemistry and
human behavior to the development of food products.

0939280A833D42AFA567E958FEA6378F.description:
Implement and evaluate the
effectiveness of a documentation procedure
used within a food products and processing
facility and recommend improvements.

3767ADD20748434A94A9EA3A7C5C977B.description:
Demonstrate and explain
methods of documentation procedures within
food products and processing systems.

3E6BAFB29D2D4B5D819BBC05294BDB45.description:
Research and describe different
electronic and paper-based documentation
methods used to meet food safety and
quality goals in food products and processing
systems.

930AE0A6D3AE4166B94C67AF43F78B69.description:
Prepare plans that ensure
implementation of proper food storage procedures.

30E4AB8AD23C4DDF94711FCF3A32E62D.description:
Analyze characteristics of
food products and determine appropriate
storage procedures.

841E3D2D217C4A1391375ABD405273DF.description:
Identify and summarize purposes
of food storage procedures (e.g., first
in/first out, temperature regulation, monitoring,
etc.).

E053FF37A0D94F88852C61D13D5663D0.description: Apply food safety procedures when storing food products to ensure food quality.

7C135CE98AE94A3BAB40F406421C3F58.description:
Conduct and interpret microbiological
tests for food-borne pathogens.

B5B7EBEBD09B40328113EA1184A54DDD.description:
Explain, document and execute
the procedures of microbiological tests
used to detect food-borne pathogens.

AC2FAA96C66A4D90AABD7DC188DD9E5A.description:
Describe the effects food-borne
pathogens have on food products and
humans.

F083937B2571415489E8F603637A9133.description:
Interpret and evaluate results
of quality assurance tests on food products
and examine steps to implement corrective
procedures.

5056044DD7204700A52DFB37333C450B.description:
Design and construct experiments
for quality assurance tests on food
products.

9EF0F3EC3A1F44BD983B9267D3BEA99C.description:
Research and summarize the
purposes and objectives of quality assurance
tests on food products (e.g., produce safety
regulation, safe food transport, food contaminants,
etc.).

912E232E463643899818E59D864BA68F.description:
Examine, interpret and report
outcomes from safe handling procedures and
results from quality assurance tests.

D6B48BDBAD57400BAC5B3BB34F03F036.description:
Construct plans that ensure
implementation of safe handling procedures
on food products.

4DB3A229021B4F97A826CC0DAE1C6CF7.description:
Research and summarize
procedures of safe handling protocols (e.g.,
Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points
Plan (HACCP); Critical Control Point procedures
(CCP); Good Agricultural Practices Plan
(GAP), etc.).

9B7A4FFB23A04D38B2D663CEB87B3B88.description:
Identify sources of contamination
in food products and/or processing
facilities and develop ways to eliminate contamination.

F88BF3B2797D4DFBAB8ADABCAFE25614.description:
Outline procedures to eliminate
possible contamination hazards associated
with food products and processing.

211F01DB91894C37846913E3A3E76C9D.description:
Examine and identify contamination
hazards associated with food products
and processing (e.g., physical, chemical
and biological).

0550E8F0C1EE4A298CDB3E48EB5A159E.description:
Apply food safety and sanitation procedures in the handling and processing of food
products to ensure food quality.

DF452C0367F54FFC96E5E115D0D918E3.description:
Devise and implement strategies
to maintain equipment and facilities for
food products and processing systems.

03BD74F1F1854260AAE95DE82266A92F.description:
Assess specifications and
maintenance needs for equipment and facilities
used in food products and processing
systems (e.g., specifications for machines,
sanitation procedures, repair protocol, etc.)

0E80DB9E08C54508A492F7F07F9EB8A3.description:
Research and categorize
types of equipment used in food products
and processing systems.

AE9D82F941024CCB8601D00DDD6EE43F.description:
Construct plans that ensure
implementation of safety programs for food
products and processing facilities.

5E691BFFD83849858EDB8D5DAB16B933.description:
Analyze and document
attributes and procedures of current safety
programs in food products and processing
facilities.

6FFF920F3E194C1D96F8901E37018ACD.description:
Research and summarize the
purposes and objectives of safety programs
in food products and processing facilities
(e.g., Sanitation Standard Operating Procedures
(SSOP); Good Manufacturing Practices
(GMP); worker safety, etc.).

2A829DAB794E4C75A356DFAA0742050F.description:
Analyze and manage operational and safety procedures in food products and
processing facilities.

81D2A3250360497999AEE3766CD7F08D.description:
Develop and implement procedures to ensure safety, sanitation and
quality in food product and processing facilities.
